CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 12-01-2015, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: bp BPs Tal Fees Be rane pers cpa 2015/KER/1276 Cri.MC.No. 7166 of 2014 () APPENDIX PETITIONER'S ANNEXURS : ANNEXURE At1: COPY OF THE FIR NO. 44/2014 DT 9/1/2014. ANNEXURE Az: COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT BY THE R2. ANNEXURE A3: COPY OF THE ORDER IN CRL.M.C. NO. 3859/2014 DT 1/9/2014. RESPONDENT'S ANNEXURES : NIL. TRUE COPY!! P.A.TO JUDGE bp Pipa 2015/KER/1276 K.ABRAHAM MATHEW, J. Crl.M.C.No.7166 of 2014. Dated this the 12 day of January, 2015. ORDER The petitioner is the first accused in Crime No.44/2014 of Eravipuram Police Station registered for the offences under Sections 323 and 498A IPC. The other accused are their close relatives. The second respondent is his wife. It is submitted that the proceedings as against the co-accused have already been quashed by this Court since the matter has been settled. The second respondent has entered appeared through a counsel and filed a petition to the effect that the matter has been settled between her and the petitioner and she has no objection to the proceedings in the criminal case being quashed as against the petitioner also. 2. Heard, the learned counsel for the petitioner and the learned Public Prosecutor and perused the petition filed by the second respondent. I am satisfied that the Bel iene 2015/KER/1276 Crl.M.C.No.7166/2014. 2 allegations are true and this is a fit case to quash the proceedings in the criminal case. 3. In the result, this application is allowed. The proceedings in Crime No.44/2014 of Eravipuram Police Station are quashed as against the petitioner. Sd/- K.ABRAHAM MATHEW, (Judge) Kvs/- ( true copy )
